result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Todd Clauer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall have such assessments, treatment, counseling and programming as DOC deems appropriate. 
Defendant shall not possess any firearms.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Todd Clauer

records.addlTxt: Defendant Michael Todd Clauer in court.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ian Mickelson in court for Michael Todd Clauer. Defendant will be pleading to charge. State will recommend 3 years probation with the following conditions: counseling deemed appropriate by DOC, not to possess any firearms, and court costs. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Defendant pleads no contest. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. Court reviews rights lost due to felony conviction. State heard. Attorney Mickelson heard. Court heard and orders 1 year probation with the following conditions: court waives court costs, provide a DNA sample, to have such assessment, counseling, programming, and treatment that DOC deems appropriate, and not to posses any firearms. If revoked, 16 days credit.

Defendant Michael Todd Clauer appeared by video.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ian Mickelson in court for Michael Todd Clauer. Court sets Status: 7/20/22 at 10:00 am. JT weeks: 8/2/22 & 8/9/22

Jury trial scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on July 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on June 13, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Michael Todd Clauer appeared by video, in custody from Grant County Jail.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ian Mickelson in court for Michael Todd Clauer. Defendant waives formal reading and pleads not guilty to charge. Attorney Michelson requests to be heard on a bond reduction. Attorney Michelson heard and requests a lower cash bond or a signature bond. Attorney Riniker heard on bond. Court heard and reduces bond to $200 cash. Status date set.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael Todd Clauer appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Anthony Pozorski in court for State of Wisconsin. Court explains charges, penalties and right to counsel. Defendant referred to SPD. Keep trying to make contact. State requests $500 cash bond, each file, totaling $2500. Defendant heard. Court sets bond at $500, each case, totaling $2500. Arraignment set.
Arraignment scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant Michael Todd Clauer not in court, Attorney Anthony Pozorski appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Warrant authorized on State's motion.
